attributes.action: Make all cyclists wear helmets and have insurance cover a legal requirement.
attributes.background: All cyclists should have to wear an approved standard helmet to reduce head injury if they come off their bikes.  They should also have to have insurance cover in case they damage, injure a third party or other vehicle. As at present there is no easy method to get a cyclist to pay for damage caused.
attributes.additional_details: Cyclist need to be protected from themselves in the same way that drivers were protected from themselves by the introduction of safety laws  (wearing seat belts). This would reduce deaths and the cost of health care levied on the NHS.  Cyclist should have insurance cover to ride on the road so if they inadvertently cause damage to another vehicle or person, then that person or vehicle damaged will have a simple method of recovering damages without having to go through a costly legal process.

attributes.action: Change the law so that in court each side always pays their own legal costs
attributes.background: Going to court is hugely in favour of the party with the biggest financial clout. They can afford to risk legal costs that the smaller party can't. The smaller party has no control over the larger parties cost yet may have to pay them. There is no other business where you can't control your costs.

attributes.action: Make road cycling safer by introducing a law to enforce reflective clothing.
attributes.background: I am a cyclist and a motorist, but i feel strongly that too many cyclists are not aware that they are not visible in dark clothing. By introducing a law, we can help cut down road traffic accidents involving cyclists and improve their general safety.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I are members of Catford Cycling Club - which is one of the oldest in the U.K. We have been cycling many years. I regularly have to make cyclists aware that they are not visible on the road.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using lane 2 between 06:00 to 22:00 hrs on 2 lane highways
attributes.background:
With the introduction of 4 lane smart motorways traffic congestion is worse than ever. HGV's are now actively using lanes 1,2 & 3 restricting every other vehicle to lane 4.

On 2 lane highways they sit side by side for mile after mile unable to pass and holding up other faster moving vehicles.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Between 06:00 and 22:00 hrs no HGV may use lane 2.
2. If the overtaking HGV is unable to pass a slower vehicle in under 90 seconds and safely pull in back in then the move should not be attempted.
3. HGV's must not use lane 3 on "smart" motorways.
4. HGV's up to 7.5 tonnes may not use lane 4 on smart motorways, anyone found doing so should receive 6 penalty points and a £1000 fine. Use of the overhead cameras to identify culprits could be used.

attributes.action: Call an immediate election if anything in a manifesto is not actioned as stated
attributes.background: Any amendment to a manifesto in government creates an issue of trust. If a government makes pledges that are unrealistic or exaggerated they should be held to account. Pledges should be time specific. An independent panel of judges will rule, and ask parliament to hold an election as appropriate

attributes.action: Government to help Monarch (now in administration)
attributes.background: If the Government could step in and either loan it money or buy it and have Monarch run as a State entity, it could prevent so many job losses and retain happy customers, as well as having an asset.
attributes.additional_details: Monarch had many bookings and customers at the time of its collapse. It has a strong and loyal staff base. This airline can be saved for the good of all.

attributes.action: Get Government to give social services more money
attributes.background: I got brought into foster care in 2008 and throughout the years I have seen how the lack of funding has affected how these services have worked. Social workers are given over 30 young people to look after when the most they should have is 16.Lack of funds means they can't give the service they want.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/sep/26/cuts-to-social-services-and-increased-tax-revenue-deliver-reduced-budget-defcit
We need more social workers yet they can't be hired because there isn't enough funding. The funding for social services has slowly been decreased until they're almost at breaking point now. Social workers are forced to leave vulnerable young people with carers without being introduced. Its harmful to the children and the parents and is causing emotional distress.

attributes.action: Increase efficiency of motorways by permitting overtaking on the left.
attributes.background: The UK motorway network is one of the most congested in Europe. The UK government are spending £ millions implementing "smart motorways" to help increase efficiency. The problem is NOT just volume of traffic, but because motorists don't abide by Highway code rule 264 leading to 'empty lanes'.
attributes.additional_details: Penalties to motorists ignoring rule 264 (keeping in the left lane unless overtaking) were introduced, but the decrease in motorway police patrols means this rarely enforced. Many motorists still habitually drive in Lane 2 while Lane 1 is empty;this forces all faster moving traffic into Lane 3 so becomes full 'nose to tail' and motorways operate below optimum capacity. By allowing overtaking on the left (as the USA) ALL lanes of motorways would be fully utilised to increase capacity at no cost.

attributes.action: Fund retraining of local authority health officers at every level
attributes.background: Fully fund awareness training of local council health officers at every level to recognise their obligations to enforce prosecutions of slum rogue landlords when issuing improvement notices.Vulnerable tenants and families are placed at greater risk of exploitation by current legislation.
attributes.additional_details:
Local authories work with slum landlords by communicating direct with them instead of engaging with and involving the tenant throughout.
This process needs to be more transparent with accountability at every stage .
Private sector tenants are disenfranchised by the current legislation.
This allows slum landlords to bypass the tenants concerns and issues and communicate directly with local councils and place vulnerable tenants at risk.Council staff EHOs need more training at every level

attributes.action: Make car insurance companies give their "BEST PRICE" when they send your renewal
attributes.background:
I received my car insurance renewal and it went up by £100, I shopped around and got a better price, I then called my current insurers and following some haggling they dropped the premiums by 23%.
I want the government to make insurers give their "BEST PRICE" on the renewal and not make you haggle

attributes.action: Make snow days a compulsory paid day off
attributes.background: We are asking the government to make snow days a compulsory paid day off we ask that under a amber warning for snow that if you cannot get into work or the company that you work for does not trade that we are paid for it

attributes.action: Write off all the student loans up to the current academic year.
attributes.background:
All student loans are mis-sold. The main reasons are:
Lack of information provided at the time of agreement i.e. interest rates and the term of the loan.
No information or support provided during the term of the loan.
No communication provided after the course ended on how much is owed.
attributes.additional_details:
Student loans have been a huge scam, pulling in students by millions and selling them an idea of a cheap loan. All the loans should be written off, new regulations and guidelines should put into place from next academic year so students know what they are getting themselves into.There is a serious breach of duty of care which the government owes to us all as the loans are provided by the government.
https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/jun/04/student-loans-really-were-mis-sold

attributes.action: Introduce a law for raised minimum temperature for employees or send home.
attributes.background: Worked as Receptionist & had poor work temperatures & inadequate heating for building. I feel it's important a law is put in place to outline a realistic,acceptable minimum & maximum work environment temperature for all employees or send employees home if needs are not met. As 16C is too cold.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The workplace (Health, Safety & Welfare) regulations 1992. 

There is "no law outlining the  minimum or maximum work environment temperature. According to Health & Safety executive a "reasonable" work environment should be provided by employers. According to the approved code of practice, a workplace should be atleast 16C and 13C for an environment that requires rigorous physical effort." I feel this is too cold for most in a work environment. This should be assessed and changed.

attributes.action: Mandy’s Law:  “Carers' Charter", Supporting Carers mainly in the Home
attributes.background: Support carers and their families caring at home. More financial and physical support to help relieve the enormous stress and strains put on their lives. I have been a carer three times during a forty year period and personally seen and endured this most destructive way of life caring can often be.
attributes.additional_details:
Carers Allowance increase to £95pw and free from income assessment
Carers in receipt of a State Pension must also qualify for Carers Allowance .
Mortgage Interest allowance increase up to £300000
Up to six hours free home care to give Carers time to shop and rest
Return Community Care back into the hands of the NHS
Free prescriptions for all full time Home Carers
Free respite care to provide time for Carers education and time out
Full grants for ex child carers to move on to College / University

attributes.action: Set a legal maximum stake of £2 for fixed odds betting machines (FOBTS)
attributes.background:
Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this

B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds. There should be a legal maximum stake of £2 to protect people who are addicted to gambling.
attributes.additional_details:
Betting can be fun, but addiction isn't.
 
When the fun stops, stop. The fun has stopped - there are over 400,000 problem gamblers, with more than 2 million 'at risk' - so stop the FOBTs.
 
A £2 maximum stake (as already is in place on b3 games/ 'slots') would still allow serious, but stable gamblers to  win big, but not on the 'crack-cocaine' of gambling. 

We call on the Government to take this action to protect vulnerable people and to fix the problem in gambling.

attributes.action: Make it law that pubs and restaurants have to have diet lemonade available
attributes.background: If you want lemonade in a pub or restaurant then there is a good chance you have to have full sugar content lemonade. For those of us who are watching our waist line or have diabetes this is a real problem.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much pressure now for us all to reduce our sugar intake and pubs and restaurants should aid us in doing this. Also for those of us who are the designated driver and do not like coke/pepsi, this really restricts the drinks available to us.

attributes.action: End PFI in the NHS
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, are disappointed that the Prime Minister has not ruled out the possibility of US companies having any involvement in the NHS as part of a post-Brexit trade deal with the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
We are concerned that allowing such involvement will lock the British taxpayer into long-term debt, especially should any NHS trust involved require additional funding.

We are further concerned that the needs of private financiers and banks will dictate the shape, size and scale of our health services and that the high costs of PFI debt charges means that the NHS will be unable to operate as it would have done through conventional procurement funding.

We therefore call upon the British Government not only to rule out US or any other foreign company involvement in the NHS post-Brexit but to commit to no extension to or further PFI funding arrangements across all NHS services.

attributes.action: Make sending sexual photo/film with or WITHOUT intent to cause distress illegal
attributes.background:
Section 33 of Criminal Justice and Court Act 2015
1)It is an offence for a person to disclose a private sexual photograph or film if the disclosure is made
(a)without the consent of an individual who appears in the photograph or film, and
(b)with the intention of causing that individual distress.
attributes.additional_details:
In section (8) the law says: "A person charged with an offence under this section is not to be taken to have disclosed a photograph or film with the intention of causing distress merely because that was a natural and probable consequence of the disclosure"

This law creates a loophole for criminals who did not consider their victim's reaction or the probable consequences of disclosure. The law needs to be reworded to 'with or without intent to cause distress' as the victim suffers despite intent

attributes.action: more funding for schools to tackle mental health issues in staff and students.
attributes.background: We want schools to gain more access to mental health facilities that can greatly benefit their staff and students. Many people suffer in silence because of the lack of support that they can get, we want to change this to make sure that nobody suffers alone. This may include onsite counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health can change the way in which you take in information and how you perform in your daily life. This can affect the way that staff will teach and how the students make progress in their examinations. Mental health issues can often lead to you not doing mandatory things such as eating and getting enough sleep, these are very important factors needed to continue a healthy lifestyle.

attributes.action: Free residential or nursing care for everyone who fought during WW 2.
attributes.background: People who risked their lives for our country are now forced to give up everything to pay for their care.

attributes.action: Make MPs provide an annual report to constituents on the work they've done
attributes.background: We are often told by politicians of their intentions at the time they wish for a vote, but accountability is often lost between elections. I ask that all politicians be required to provide a full, non election based report to all constituents on the progress they make on their pledges and beyond.

attributes.action: Ban homework for Year 11 students a few months before the GCSE exams
attributes.background: I think that homework should be banned because it gives us little time to revise. It takes up most of our time at home that we have after school, and leaves us with only maybe 1 hour to revise after the homework. One hour a day is not enough for GCSE students.

attributes.action: Remove VAT from home insulation and damp proofing products.
attributes.background:
Home insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion are the top three most effective and simple means of reducing energy cost and emissions whilst improving environmental health.
Charging VAT on insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion is hobbling those who do most to help the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The laws of physics and the governments own agencies agree with the priorities for energy efficiency and reduction of environmental cost/ damage.
Removal of VAT would be the single, simplest and most effective action whilst avoiding the high administration cost of the more complex and corruptible schemes.

attributes.action: More citizen, human and working rights lessons into the educational curriculum
attributes.background: a lot of blood and tears was spilled building the cornerstones of what rights we enjoy today as humans, citizens and workers. Unfortunately a lot of young people miss out on this vital information and children should be educated about what rights they have so they are prepared for the real world

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for supermarket chains to display air miles on fruit.
attributes.background: Fresh fruit often travels to the UK by air, which creates huge amounts of CO2. People need the information on packaging to make choices and reduce their CO2 footprint.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people do not realise the CO2  of their food, especially when it travels by air. Aeroplanes are huge contributors to climate change.
Providing the air travel information on fruit packaging would give people the tools to reduce their CO2 footprint, and help us stop climate change.

attributes.action: Make Public Company Directors Personally Liable for Company Failures
attributes.background: In the UK we have created a corporate environment where Company Directors are rewarded for success and failure. This is different for SME owners where risk taking is offset by the potential of losing everything, including their home. We believe such rules should apply to Corporate Directors.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that there needs to be greater accountability by Public Company Directors. We believe there needs to be a change to corporate law where, to be a Company Director of a PLC (or any company on a public share exchange), individuals have to provide personal securities commensurate with the financial rewards. These securities should extend to pension provisions.
By introducing a personal element of risk to Senior Executives, irresponsible risk taking will be eliminated in our major PLCs.

attributes.action: Electrocardiogram (ECG) scans should be made compulsory for all young people.
attributes.background: Test every teenager for deadly undiagnosed heart defects that kills 12 people every week in the UK. 80% of heart defects are found through ECG scans, as there are no symptoms - meaning hundreds of lives would be saved each year. One in 500 people suffer and their hearts could stop at any point.
attributes.additional_details: Renowned cardiologist Professor Sanjay Sharma, medical director for the virgin London Marathon and Professor of Cardiology at St George's University Hospital, agrees saying: 'Each week 12 young people in the UK die suddenly from a heart condition they didn't know they had.' 'The vast majority of those - more than 80% - won't have symptoms, but the same proportion would have been picked up through a three minute ECG.'

attributes.action: Devolve responsibility for immigration policy in Scotland.
attributes.background: It looks like the EU migrants are now leaving the UK after Brexit and we don’t want that.  So, I call on the UK government to devolve some powers over immigration, especially the responsibility over immigration policy to the Scottish Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: We, Scots welcome immigrants to come and live in Scotland, and work in Scotland, when England doesn’t.  We welcome especially EU migrants, who pay their taxes raised in Scotland and contribute to our economy and if they go, we will miss out.  So we need them.  I know we haven’t known about this before, but countries like Canada and Australia have regional/provincial immigration policies within a nation-wide framework.

attributes.action: Enlarge the area eligible for high cost area supplements for NHS staff
attributes.background:
The cost of living in South East England in areas such as Brighton and Hove is now on par with London. 

NHS staff in these areas are struggling to meet the basic costs of living such as rent, food and travel. We propose extending the fringe area eligible for high cost area supplement to Sussex.

attributes.action: Hold a Royal Commission on the future funding of the NHS and Adult Social Care
attributes.background: With the merging of the NHS and Adult Social Care briefs, now is the time to hold a Royal Commission on the future direction of a funding model for the NHS and Adult Social Care.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS and Adult Social Care briefs have recently been merged.
With ever increasing pressure on our NHS and Adult Social Care budgets, now is the time to look at a long term solution for funding, training and investment in the long-term future direction of the NHS and Adult Social Care. 
A Royal Commission should be established with a medical professional chairing it to take opinions from professionals and experts on how to take the NHS and Adult Social Care forward.

attributes.action: Make employers specify a minimum salary on all job adverts
attributes.background: UK average salary increases insufficient as living costs continue to rise sharply. Job seekers deserve transparency. Companies offering 'competitive' salaries complicate the process of finding employment and hinder job seekers from comparing potential income and making an informed choice.
attributes.additional_details:
If companies are forced to advertise a minimum salary it becomes easier for a job seeker to determine the suitability of a certain position. It cuts the inefficiency of time and money spent on applications with no hope of employment and helps to ensure employers can't widen already established pay gaps, offer job seekers a deserved level of clarify and transparency.

https://www.ons.gov.uk/employmentandlabourmarket/peopleinwork/earningsandworkinghours

attributes.action: Put a revenue tax on all retail sales in the UK.
attributes.background: At the moment our retailers are losing out to the big conglomerates, who pay little or no Corporation tax in the same proportion as UK based companies.
attributes.additional_details: Amazon and Google are prime examples and some food and coffee chains use similar global means to reduce their UK taxes-particularly corporation tax. The Corporation tax could then be replaced by the new revenue tax on goods and services sold in the UK.

attributes.action: Parliament to require all minibus drivers to have a special minibus license
attributes.background: Current law allows drivers with a car licence to drive vehicles with seating capacity between 9 and 16 seats under certain circumstances (see below) without the need for a vocational licence or specialised training thereby putting the lives of passengers at risk. This must be stopped!
attributes.additional_details:
Amongst the conditions that need to be met in order to drive a minibus (with up to 16 seats) with a car driving licence include the following: 
'you’re driving on a voluntary basis and the minibus is used for social purposes by a non-commercial body.
the maximum weight of the minibus is not more than 3.5 tonnes - or 4.25 tonnes including specialist equipment for disabled passengers, for example a wheelchair ramp."

However these are blatantly being abused and our children's lives are at risk!

attributes.action: Adopt a stance of permanent military neutrality, as a nation state.
attributes.background: Military intervention has been largely unpopular and entirely ineffective at ending the issues it claims plague the world. Conquest is forbidden as a peremptory norm, aggression is mostly too. Self defense implies neutrality, saving 1-1.5% of GDP each year to spend on other sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the time of the Peace of Westphalia, the military has lost two of its three purposes. Internal revolt and crime being dealt with by local police forces, the right of conquest being outlawed per jus cogens, only self defense remains. Neutrality is a natural and rational position when self defense is the only legal use of arms. 

Largely, neutral countries such as Switzerland, Austria, Ireland, Finland spend 0.5-1% of GDP on their militaries. That equates to £20-30bn in savings per year.

attributes.action: Put grammar schools in all counties
attributes.background: Lots of high school children are held back in their current schools. If they go to a grammar school they will be encouraged, pushed, and will improve greatly!

attributes.action: More funding for the National Health Service and take it out of crisis
attributes.background: I have seen casualty departments where people are begging for help, I've seen where patients are being kept in corridors and I've seen nurses and doctors struggle to provide the appropriate care required when they are stretched to their limit.

attributes.action: Give tax breaks to parents who support their children through university
attributes.background:
I am supporting my daughter through university. 
Why not treat these payments in the same way as gift aid? , reimburse my daughter the 20% tax on the value that I've paid to her?

attributes.action: To arm all police officers with handguns
attributes.background: I believe all police officers should be armed with handguns for officers protection. Over the last 2 years terror attacks have become increasingly regular and some could have been stopped with a simple shot from an officer. It will add security to the job of law enforcement and act as a deterrent
attributes.additional_details: In America it has been seen that police can be attacked and that a handgun can prevent that. It can also bring an end to criminal situations much faster.

attributes.action: Lower the price of road tax for petrol and increase the price for diesel
attributes.background: It is said that Diesel cars emit more harmful pollutants, why should road tax be so much cheaper for diesel? it only encourages more people to use diesel.

attributes.action: Ban (Prospective) Employers asking about salary history from job applicants
attributes.background: Law makers say asking about salary history continues the cycle of pay inequality and makes it harder for people to change careers/jobs. The salary question is a hidden,yet,pervasive form of discrimination. It enables employers to use potential employee's past salary to determine the salary to offer.
attributes.additional_details:
Some states in the U.S (e.g. New York city) has already passed the law (in 2017) prohibiting employers to ask about salary history in interviews or on applications.
By banning the question during the hiring process, employers will be required to offer jobs and compensation to prospective employees based on their own skills, merit and demands of the job, not gender, race or ethnicity.
Banning salary history question is the next step to take in the fight to end the pay gap.

attributes.action: Make private ownership of reptiles and amphibians a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Three quarters of all pet reptiles dies within a year, that is around six millions animals. Having reptiles and amphibians as pets is cruel because they suffer in captivity and cannot be looked after properly.

attributes.action: Fine* patients who do not attend (DNA) NHS hospital appointments.
attributes.background:
DNAs: 
- Cost the NHS an estimated £225 million in 2012 to 2013° 
- Result in extended waiting lists 
- Are an inefficient use of staff 
- Occurred in around 5.6 million (9% of the total) NHS outpatient appointments in England between 2014 to 2015°° 
(See additional details for sources °and°°)
attributes.additional_details:
Appointments where a patient does not show or provide prior notice are regarded as DNAs (did not attend). 
*To reduce DNAs, provide an incentive from as little as a £1 circumstantial charge to encourage patients to cancel. Thus freeing a space for those who can attend the appointment.
°Source: The National Audit Office 
°°Source: Quarterly Hospital Activity Data, 2015
Additional information:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hospitals-and-patients-urged-to-take-action-on-missed-appointments

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for people to pass a politics test before they can vote
attributes.background: Make it a requirement for people to have to pass a political competency test in order to be allowed to vote in General Elections, or in Nationwide Referendums. Brexit is a stark reminder; it only takes a small percentage of the population to be politically uneducated to sway a huge national decision
attributes.additional_details: A exam to test background knowledge of basic political systems, taken a few weeks before an upcoming election. This could then be marked over the following days, and anyone who passed will be sent a verification code or something similar to enable them to vote on Election Day. An in depth analysis of how the population did overall on the exam could then be published, allowing political parties to see what areas of knowledge/ which demographics they could address in future election campaigns.

attributes.action: Introduce a 10% maximum limit on a university's intake from independent schools.
attributes.background: 7% of children in Britain go to an independent school. In this age of soaring inequality, the fact that around 40% of offers of a place at Oxbridge, and around 25% from the Russell Group of top universities, go to these students is simply shocking. It is 2017, not 1917. Enough is enough.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite promises from the top universities to improve their systems for admissions, figures released by MP David Lammy, show the situation to be worsening. 82% of offers from Oxford and 81% from Cambridge went to students from the top two socio-economic groups in 2015, up from 79% at both universities five years earlier.* 

The government must act. A withdrawl of public funding, plus significant fines for offending institutions should be implemented immediately.

*The Guardian 19 10 2017

attributes.action: Create a non-profit National Public Insurance company.
attributes.background: Insurance prices are very expensive for all drivers, therefore the goverment should look into making a national public insurance organisation which is non profit and which is considerably less in cost.
attributes.additional_details: Having vehicle insurance in compulsory, and by making it so that it must be purchased from a private firm. The organisation must have lower prices than private firms and should have the backing of the government. The goverment should only pay into the organisation till start up, until it is able to sustain itself.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of germ spreading by licking fingers to open bags/give out paper
attributes.background: Many stores have staff who decide to lick their fingers to make it easier to open carrier bags. This is a serious health and safety issue as it can cause the spread of illnesses and diseases. It is very unhygienic and disgusting and shouldn't be the norm. They can use water instead.
attributes.additional_details: Licking fingers is also often done within schools, organisations and institutions where they give out papers, forms and applications etc. The UK Government needs to launch an awareness campaign to help stop this unhygienic practice.

attributes.action: Allow young people who are members of a political party to vote at 16.
attributes.background: Young people who have a political party membership should be allowed to vote at 16 because being a member of a party shows a basic if not good understanding of politics.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Business Rates for Small Businesses
attributes.background: Business Rates in this country are driving existing Businesses into debt and liquidation, preventing them from expanding and new Businesses from forming. The extortionate cost of Business Rates are set far too high and there is very little help available and no incentive for Local Councils to help
attributes.additional_details: To run a Business, premises are often required. Different types of Businesses have different requirements. For example, a Small Office Business may run with low Business Rates and a high turn-over. Where as a Small Manufacturer may require a much larger premises, huge Business Rates, and have a smaller profit margin. We need a fairer and balanced Business Rates system that works for the different types of Businesses, because at the moment it is killing our Small Businesses and preventing growth

attributes.action: Examine viable options for nationalising Thames Water.
attributes.background: In March 2018 up to 20,000 London households suffered an unplanned interruption in their water supply.  This lasted several days and caused significant hardship and distress. It was likely due to vital infrastructure being unable to cope with adverse weather conditions due to underinvestment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jan/09/nationalise-rail-gas-water-privately-owned

https://www.theguardian.com/business/nils-pratley-on-finance/2017/nov/24/thames-water-explains-why-nationalisation-is-suddenly-popular

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2017/07/01/thames-water-bows-ofwat-pressure-chairman-heads-exit/

https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/ofwat-statement-thames-water-leakage-commitments/

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/nov/30/thames-water-ofwat-performance

attributes.action: Post on Motorway message boards to remind middle lane 'Hoggers' to Pull Over
attributes.background:
Every driver has experienced being in a long tail back as one lorry slowly edges past another. 

Drivers can now be given 3 points for not pulling back into the Left-hand lane but this is not enforced. 

Why not use the Electronic signs to remind drivers to use the left to improve traffic flow?
